page.title: 14Waddingham village Hall
page.content: The Village Hall in Waddingham was opened in 1977,the year of the Queen's Silver Jubilee.It is the centre of almost every activty in Waddingham and the surrounding area.Playschool is held every Tuesday Wednesday Thursday. It is held in the main Hall.The lady who makes the arrangments is Mrs Parkinson.Some of the Mums help her by tidying up and looking after the children.Every day the children have a drink and a biscuit.At Easter they have Easter fairs.They raise money to buy climbing frames and tunnels. Sometimes the children have their photos taken.They have Christmas parties.They have Discos every so often which are held in the main hall.It is usually sixty pence to get in.At the Discos there are flashing lights and a big stereo.
